meanings.definition: Plural noun: threats, violence, constraints, or other action used to coerce someone into doing something against their will.
meanings.sent1: The duresses from the bullies made him give up his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The duresses of the kidnappers made the family pay the ransom.
meanings.sent3: The duresses of the strict teacher made the students study harder.
meanings.sent4: The duresses of the storm forced everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The duresses of the deadline pushed him to work late into the night.

meanings.definition: Verb: to force someone to do something by using threats or violence.
meanings.sent1: She duresses her employees to meet unrealistic targets.
meanings.sent2: The criminal duresses the witness to change their testimony.
meanings.sent3: He duresses his friends into watching scary movies with him.
meanings.sent4: The dictator duresses the citizens into obedience through fear.
meanings.sent5: The bully duresses the younger kids to give him their toys.
